page.title: 16ROAD AND RAIL
page.content: In our area we have one-man-operated buses. Some S.P.T.E. services run into the city centre, others offer a local service, and the Scottish Bus Group run out to Renfrew and beyond. Buses run to a timetable. Inspectors check the passengers' tickets. Children under 5 years travel free and some buses are adapted to cater for the disabled. The underground system is known as the Subway. Govan, Ibrox and Cessnock Stations are all in our area, and run to the city centre. In recent years many millions of pounds have been spent modernising this system. British Rail run a train service from Glasgow Central to Gourock. Our local stations on that line are Hillington East and Cardonald. The M8 motorway serves both inner city and inter-city road users.
